intro: Calochortus bruneaunis, commonly known as the Sierra Valley mariposa lily, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has linear to lance-shaped leaves and produces a single flower per stem, which blooms in the spring. Calochortus bruneaunis is often found in regions with well-drained soils and is adapted to dry, temperate climates.
